paper_abstract: Consider the cross-correlation function C(d)(tau) between two in-sequences of period p(2k) - 1 that differ by a decimation d. Assume that d is of Niho type and C(d)(tau) is four-valued. In this correspondence, the values of C(d)(tau) are described. If p = 2 then the values of C(d)(tau) are -1-2(k), -1, -1+2(k), and -1+2(k+j) for some integer j > 0 for which 2j divides k. If p > 2 then the values are -1-p(k), -1, -1+p(k), and -1+2.p(k).
paper_title: On four-valued Niho-type cross-correlation functions of m-sequences
